seg.seg: Beyond that, to someone striving without measure for the status of Sakṛdāgāmin ...
What is the sense of giving to a Pratyekabuddha? Beyond that, (what) ...
... queen Gautamī speaks to the Buddha-god the teacher: But what is (the difference) between the two, o venerable one?
(or) is it a weak difference between the two? || The Buddha-god the teacher says: Big ...
... (if) one invites only (one) monk ..., and treats this one correctly, all Communities ...
… (who) invites only one monk …, and treats him correctly, all communities … (cf 189)
... (if) one pays homage precisely to ..., (if one gives) shelter (?) up to birth in a new existence, in all without making a difference ...
|| If to anyone someone correctly gives a Pudgalika gift, from this action indeed there arises merit.
If to anyone someone deals correctly with a Pudgalika gift, from this action indeed merit arises. (cf 189)
... a Pudgalika gift, even a single one produces merit. || In the Maitär [tune] || When, oh Gautamī, ...
... is not to be ... When you again give to the Community, oh Gautamī, the Community ...
if you give [it] to the community again, Gautamī, the community … (cf 189)
(If this) is (so), I will give a gift, o venerable one, to the Community. || The Buddha-god the teacher ... Ānanda ...
(If this) is (so), o venerable one, I will give a gift to the community. (cf 189)
... when the Community is assembled, then you handle the matter of the jewel of a cotton cloth, oh Ānanda!
… when the community is assembled, then you handle the matter of the jewel of a cotton cloth!
... queen (Gautamī) says: When, beginning with Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, the Arhats ...
... they will (be) ..., they as a result will be called the entire Community. How if the Buddha-god the teacher ...
... the Śākyas having become overjoyed, they venerate the feet of the Buddha-god the teacher, three (times) ...
... having accomplished ..., he left the Śākyas and from land to land (did) the deeds belonging to the rank of a Buddha.
... receiving homage in all manner of ways from the inhabitants of the city of Benares, ... (close to the city of) Benares ...

p.note: This fragment contains part of the third act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; an Uy. parallel is MaitrHami III, 9b21-10b14. See also 196-7.

The translation and the following commentary are adapted from 190.
Cf. MaitrHami 3, 9 b22. In the Uyghur text, the end of the verso of the 9th leaf is missing: hence, there is no precise equivalent for the ﬁrst three lines of this leaf.
tine: these are the Saṃghālambana gift and the Pudgalika gift.
This question ﬁnds an equivalent in MaitrHami 3, 10 a1-2; for the answer of the Buddha, see MaitrHami 3, 10 a4ff.
maitraṃ: a stanza of 4 x 12 (5/7) syllables. The following text corresponds to MaitrHami 3, 10 a16-21.
Here, Gautamī is speaking, cf. MaitrHami 3, 10 a22-24.
Cf. MaitrHami 3, 10 a29-30; the six last lines of the recto of the 10th leaf are badly damaged.
The end of the fragment corresponds roughly to MaitrHami 3, 10 b14ff., but the arrival of the Buddha in Benares is narrated with less details in the Uyghur text.

This fragment contains part of the third act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; an Uy. parallel is MaitrHami III, 9b21-10b14. See also [[Pinault 1999]]: 196-7.

This text is continued from [[YQ III.9]] and continues on [[YQ III.11]].
